titles.title: American Indian Elderly and Disabled Access to Health Care Act of 2005

A bill to amend the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to permit the Indian Health Service, an Indian tribe, a tribal organization, or an urban Indian organization to pay the monthly part D premium of eligible medicare beneficiaries.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

bill.summary: 6/14/2005--Introduced. American Indian Elderly and Disabled Access to Health Care Act of 2005 - Amends the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to allow the Indian Health Service, an Indian tribe, a tribal organization, or an urban Indian organization to pay the monthly premium of an Indian who is a Medicare part D (Voluntary Prescription Drug Benefit Program) eligible individual enrolled in a prescription drug plan or a Medicare Advantage-Prescription Drug (MA-PD) plan under Medicare part D.
